instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light.
threads.message:
No water damage found at all.
PPBUS 3v42 is present with no short.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> are separate. Which one is present with no short?

Is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.16v or 8.5v?

Is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v, 0.5v, or 0v?

Is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> present at the dc in board connector? 

Is the flat cable between the dc in board and dc in cable in good condition?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light.
threads.message:
Is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.16v or 8.5v? 8.15v

Is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v, 0.5v, or 0v? <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> reading is pin 2 0.001 pin 1 3.13v resistor might be shot also just noticed <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> looks like garbage corroded


Is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> present at the dc in board connector?  yes


Is the flat cable between the dc in board and dc in cable in good condition? looks good but red dot is red

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light.
threads.message: You have an SMC reset issue. Replace <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> and clean the crap up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light.
threads.message: Done. We get a fan spin. now. Pads were ripped under the <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is there a technique that can be used here to replace these pads when you have chips with no legs. I used a wire from cleaning wick and it worked but is there something more solid that can be done. ? cause the chip was kind of uneven.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light.
threads.message: Nope, just use some fine wire. You can mash it flat a little bit more, but that is just how you do this.
